metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5953 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
vim before patch 8.0.0322 does not properly validate values for tree lengthwhen handling a spell file, which may result in an integer overflow at amemory allocation site and a resultant buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5953` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1
vim-athena - 2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1
vim-common - 2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1
vim-gnome - 2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1
vim-gtk - 2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1
vim-gtk3 - 2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1
vim-gui-common - 2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1
vim-nox - 2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1
vim-runtime - 2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1
vim-tiny - 2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1
xxd - 2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

neovim - 0.2.2-3
neovim-runtime - 0.2.2-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vim package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1').
neovim package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.2.2-3').
